wikipedia_page.main:
Harry Hampton (1773 – 12 November 1845) was an English professional cricketer who played during the early 19th century.
Hampton was born in Surrey in 1773. He made his first-class cricket debut in 1800 for a Surrey XI in 1800 and went on to make a total of six appearances in first-class matches, his last coming in 1811.Hampton died at Peckham, then in Surrey, in 1845.

response: Harry Hampton was a recipient of the Victoria Cross.
Harry Hampton may also refer to:
|Played 45 first-class matches, including 18 for Surrey. Brother of Harry Hampton but, other than a surname and initial, no biographical information is known.
